summary: The diff implements all five requirements. A WeeklyCalendarView component with 7-column grid, week navigation, date-range header, and empty-state placeholders was added. A CalendarCaseCard showing Pet Name, MRN, species icon, presenting complaint, task status icons, and completed-case shading was added. DashboardView was modified to include a toggle (defaulting to calendar view) and to wire up the new components. Supporting utility functions (calendarUtils.ts) handle week computation, day filtering, and formatting. All REQ-1 through REQ-5 acceptance criteria appear to be satisfied.

hallucinated_features.description: CalendarCaseCard includes expand/collapse functionality (ChevronDown/ChevronUp toggle with isExpanded state), a full ChecklistEditor, edit dialog (CaseEditDialog), and a delete button (Trash2 icon with confirmation prompt).
hallucinated_features.reason: The requirements only specify displaying Pet Name, MRN, Species badge, Presenting Complaint, and task status icons with completed-case shading. Interactive expand/collapse, inline checklist editing, case edit dialog, and delete functionality from calendar cards were not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: A 'Today' button appears in the week navigation header when the user is not viewing the current week, allowing a one-click jump back to the current week.
hallucinated_features.reason: The requirements describe only Previous and Next week navigation arrows. A dedicated 'Today' shortcut button was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Day column headers display a case-count badge showing the number of cases when dayCases.length is greater than 0.
hallucinated_features.reason: The requirements do not mention a case count badge on day column headers.

hallucinated_features.description: Today's date column is visually highlighted with primary color styling on the day label and a circular background on the date number.
hallucinated_features.reason: No requirement specifies a visual highlight for the current day's column.
